Key Match Events: Scotland let a 1-0 lead slip away as Croatia beat Steve Clarke's side 2-1 in Zagreb in the UEFA Nations League.
Kristijan Jakic scored an own goal in the 94th minute, only for Che Adams to be deemed offside, and VAR overturned the goal to break Scottish hearts and deny them a point.
Billy Gilmour proved to be a handful for the experienced Croatian midfield duo of Luka Modric and Mario Pasalic.
Andrej Kramaric scored the decisive goal for Croatia in the 70th minute after a rebound from Borna Sosa's shot which was parried by Gordon.
Pre-Game Insights: Steve Clarke had to make do without several of his key players as a debilitating injury list has denied him the likes of Kieran Tierney, Jack Hendry and Aaron Hickey amongst others.
Post-Match Reflections: The loss now sees Clarke's side sit bottom of Group 1, with another clash with Portugal taking place on Tuesday at Hampden Park.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Ben Doak became the youngest player to start a competitive match for Scotland since Willie Johnston in 1965.
